TEXT: The applicants , Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON and PERSON PERSON , are NORP nationals , who were born in DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE . They are represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
On DATE , the applicant Mr PERSON died and on DATE , his heirs expressed interest in continuing his present applicant .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE an armed clash took place between the security forces and ORG militants in the applicants’ village of GPE , in district of GPE , ORG . During the clash , some of the applicants’ property was destroyed . In particular , PERSON LOC of CARDINAL dönüm ( QUANTITY ) and fruit trees , PERSON home , dairy barn and livestock , PERSON dairy barn and livestock were damaged as a result of a fire that broke out . The village guards did not allow the applicants to save their livestock during the fire .

On DATE CARDINAL gendarme officers drew up a scene of incident report . According to the report , a fire started as a result of the clash which then spread to the barns of PERSON and PERSON . The report further stated that a number of livestock belonging to these applicants were killed because of the fire .
On DATE officers from ORG took statements from PERSON and PERSON . Their statements confirmed the scene of the incident report of DATE .

PERSON and PERSON lodged petitions with the GPE Governor ’s ORG on DATE and CARDINAL DATE respectively . They requested the authorities to establish their damage but they received no response to their petitions .
PERSON and PERSON brought declaratory actions before ORG on DATE and CARDINAL DATE respectively . They requested the court to assess the damage they had sustained .

On DATE ORG decided not to hold an on - site visit in GPE as it had been informed by the district gendarme command that the area was not safe and that there was not sufficient staff or equipment to provide security for the visit .
On DATE PERSON brought a declaratory action before ORG ( ORG ) for an assessment of the damage he had suffered .
On DATE the court decided not to hold an inspection citing the same reasoning as ORG .

The investigation carried out by the authorities indicated that subsequent to their requests for compensation , PERSON and PERSON had received MONEY ( ORG ) and CARDINAL ORG respectively . The investigation further revealed that PERSON had not suffered any loss or damage upon the incidents .

The Government also pointed to ORG resulting from Terrorism and the Fight against Terrorism that was passed by ORG on DATE and entered into force on DATE ( “ Compensation Law ” ) . The Compensation Law provided for a sufficient remedy capable of redressing the ORG grievances of persons who suffered damages resulting from the fight against terrorism in the region .

In that connection , “ Damage Assessment and Compensation Commissions ” were set up in QUANTITY provinces . Persons who had suffered damage as a result of terrorism or of measures taken by the authorities to combat terrorism could lodge an application with the relevant compensation commission claiming compensation .

The number of persons applying to these commissions had already attained CARDINAL . CARDINAL persons , whose applications were pending before the ORG , had also applied to the compensation commissions . Many villagers had already been awarded compensation for the damage they had sustained .

A description of the relevant domestic law can be found in the ORG ’s decision of PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) and in its judgment of ORG and Others v. GPE ( nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL - CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL-VI )
